activities: The use of Lennox EU employee personnel data will include, but not limited to, global enterprise headcount reporting, statistical analysis, compensation planning and related transactions, career development, staffing, training (live and web based), international personal security issues and internal investigations (including investigations conducted by Lennox's Ethics & Compliance Office), administration of Lennox's Ethics Hotline, enterprise risk management initiative, insider threat initiatives (including review and monitoring of electronic data), safety analysis, performance management, succession planning, goal development, talent and skill identification, and employee directory.
eucountries: Belgium, Czech Republic, France, Germany, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Spain, United Kingdom
personaldata: human resources and personnel information, safety data, Ethics Hotline data, data related to the use of corporate assets, such as company computers and email
recoursemech: Lennox International's Ethics & Compliance Office commits to cooperate with the Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) of the EU countries in the investigation and resolution of complaints and will comply with any reasonable directives given by DPAs.
